joelib2.feature
Class FeatureHelper

java.lang.Object
  joelib2.feature.FeatureHelper

public final class FeatureHelper
extends Object

Some methods to faciliate the work with descriptors.

Method Detail

featureFrom

public static FeatureResult featureFrom(Molecule mol,
                                        String descName,
                                        boolean add)
                                 throws FeatureException
Getting descriptor values from a molecule and try to calculate a descriptor value if it is not already available. This method should NOT be used for getting common JOEGenericData elements of molecules.

Missing descriptor values can be calculated by using featureFrom(Molecule, String).
Example: 

 DescResult result=null;
 try
 {
         result=DescriptorHelper.instance().descFromMol(mol, descriptorName);
 }
 catch (DescriptorException ex)
 {
         // descriptor can not be calculated
 }
Notice the difference between JOEGenericData and FeatureResult. FeatureResult values can be added to molecules by using BasicPairData 
 PairData dp = new PairData();
 dp.setAttribute(descriptorName);
 dp.setValue(result);
 mol.addData(dp);

Parameters:
mol - The molecule
descName - The name of the descriptor
add - If true the descriptor value will be added to the molecule
Returns:
The descriptor result
Throws:
FeatureException
See Also:
featureFrom(Molecule, String), #featureFrom(Molecule, String, DescResult), Molecule#getData(JOEDataType), Molecule.getData(String), Molecule.genericDataIterator(), Molecule#addData(JOEGenericData), Molecule#addData(JOEGenericData, boolean), JOEDataType, BasicPairData, FeatureResult, BasicDataHolder.getData(String, boolean)

featureFrom

public static FeatureResult featureFrom(Molecule mol,
                                        String featureName,
                                        FeatureResult featureResult,
                                        boolean add)
                                 throws FeatureException
Getting descriptor values from a molecule and try to calculate a descriptor value if it is not already available. This method should NOT be used for getting common JOEGenericData elements of molecules.

Missing descriptor values can be calculated by using featureFrom(Molecule, String).
Example: 

 DescResult result=null;
 try
 {
         result=DescriptorHelper.instance().descFromMol(mol, descriptorName);
 }
 catch (DescriptorException ex)
 {
         // descriptor can not be calculated
 }
Notice the difference between JOEGenericData and FeatureResult. FeatureResult values can be added to molecules by using BasicPairData 
 PairData dp = new PairData();
 dp.setAttribute(descriptorName);
 dp.setValue(result);
 mol.addData(dp);
The given descriptor result is only used if this descriptor exists not already. If this descriptor exists already, then this object is returned without cloning. So you should create your own clone if you plan to modify this object.

Parameters:
mol - The molecule
featureName - The name of the descriptor
featureResult - The descriptor result
addIfNotExist - If true the descriptor value will be added to the molecule
Returns:
The descriptor result
Throws:
FeatureException
See Also:
featureFrom(Molecule, String), #featureFrom(Molecule, String, DescResult), Molecule#getData(JOEDataType), Molecule.getData(String), Molecule.genericDataIterator(), Molecule#addData(JOEGenericData), Molecule#addData(JOEGenericData, boolean), JOEDataType, BasicPairData, FeatureResult, BasicDataHolder.getData(String, boolean)

generateFeatureInfo

public static BasicFeatureInfo generateFeatureInfo(Class descClass,
                                                   String type,
                                                   String init,
                                                   String result)
Faciliates the generation of a descriptor information.

Parameters:
name - the name of the descriptor
descClass - the descriptor calculation class
type - the descriptor type
dimension - the descriptor dimension, which is needed for calculation
init - the initialization representation (DEPRECATED)
result - the name of the result class
Returns:
DescriptorInfo the descriptor information

Gets the instance of the descriptor helper factory.

the instance of the descriptor helper factory

featureFrom

public FeatureResult featureFrom(Molecule mol,
                                 String descName)
                          throws FeatureException
Getting descriptor values from a molecule and try to calculate a descriptor value if it is not already available. This method should NOT be used for getting common JOEGenericData elements of molecules. Not existing descriptor values will be added to the molecule, if the joelib2.feature.addIfNotExist property in the BasicPropertyHolder is true.

Missing descriptor values can be calculated by using featureFrom(Molecule, String).
Example: 

 DescResult result=null;
 try
 {
         result=DescriptorHelper.instance().descFromMol(mol, descriptorName);
 }
 catch (DescriptorException ex)
 {
         // descriptor can not be calculated
 }
Notice the difference between JOEGenericData and FeatureResult. FeatureResult values can be added to molecules by using BasicPairData 
 PairData dp = new PairData();
 dp.setAttribute(descriptorName);
 dp.setValue(result);
 mol.addData(dp);

Parameters:
mol - The molecule
descName - The name of the descriptor
Returns:
The descriptor result
Throws:
FeatureException
See Also:
#featureFrom(Molecule, String, DescResult), #featureFrom(Molecule, String, DescResult, boolean), Molecule#getData(JOEDataType), Molecule.getData(String), Molecule.genericDataIterator(), Molecule#addData(JOEGenericData), Molecule#addData(JOEGenericData, boolean), JOEDataType, BasicPairData, FeatureResult, BasicDataHolder.getData(String, boolean), BasicPropertyHolder

featureFrom

public FeatureResult featureFrom(Molecule mol,
                                 String descName,
                                 FeatureResult descResult)
                          throws FeatureException
Getting descriptor values from a molecule and try to calculate a descriptor value if it is not already available. This method should NOT be used for getting common JOEGenericData elements of molecules. Not existing descriptor values will be added to the molecule, if the joelib2.feature.addIfNotExist property in the BasicPropertyHolder is true.

Missing descriptor values can be calculated by using featureFrom(Molecule, String).
Example: 

 DescResult result=null;
 try
 {
         result=DescriptorHelper.instance().descFromMol(mol, descriptorName);
 }
 catch (DescriptorException ex)
 {
         // descriptor can not be calculated
 }
Notice the difference between JOEGenericData and FeatureResult. FeatureResult values can be added to molecules by using BasicPairData 
 PairData dp = new PairData();
 dp.setAttribute(descriptorName);
 dp.setValue(result);
 mol.addData(dp);

Parameters:
mol - The molecule
descName - The name of the descriptor
descResult - The descriptor result, where the result should be stored
Returns:
The descriptor result
Throws:
FeatureException
See Also:
featureFrom(Molecule, String), #featureFrom(Molecule, String, DescResult, boolean), Molecule#getData(JOEDataType), Molecule.getData(String), Molecule.genericDataIterator(), Molecule#addData(JOEGenericData), Molecule#addData(JOEGenericData, boolean), JOEDataType, BasicPairData, FeatureResult, BasicDataHolder.getData(String, boolean), BasicPropertyHolder
